metadata.description: Standards for Registered Training Organisations (RTOs) 2025 - Outcome-focused standards effective from 1 July 2025

quality_area_1.title: Quality Area 1 - Training and Assessment
quality_area_1.description: Outcome-focused requirements for quality training and assessment delivery

standards.title: Training
standards.description: Training is delivered in accordance with the requirements of training products and is designed to develop the skills and knowledge specified in the training product
requirements: Training is systematically developed, delivered and continuously improved
Training reflects current industry practices and meets learner needs
Training strategies are appropriate for the training product and learner cohort
Training delivery is flexible and responsive to learner progress
Training incorporates appropriate use of technology and resources

standards.title: Assessment
standards.description: Assessment is conducted in accordance with the principles of assessment and rules of evidence
requirements: Assessment is valid, reliable, fair and flexible
Assessment is conducted in accordance with rules of evidence (validity, sufficiency, authenticity, currency)
Assessment decisions are made by competent assessors
Assessment processes ensure integrity and quality outcomes
Assessment tools are validated regularly

standards.title: Recognition of Prior Learning and Credit Transfer
standards.description: RTOs acknowledge and give credit for skills and knowledge learners already have
requirements: RPL processes are clearly documented and accessible
Credit transfer is provided for equivalent units
RPL and credit transfer information is provided to learners
RPL assessment meets the principles of assessment and rules of evidence
Decisions on RPL and credit transfer are timely and evidence-based

standards.title: Facilities, Resources and Equipment
standards.description: Training and assessment is delivered with appropriate facilities, resources and equipment
requirements: Facilities are fit for purpose and meet regulatory requirements
Resources reflect current industry practices and training product requirements
Equipment is appropriate, well-maintained and safe to use
Learning resources are accessible to all learners
Physical and digital resources support quality training outcomes

quality_area_2.title: Quality Area 2 - VET Student Support
quality_area_2.description: Outcome-focused requirements for student information, support and wellbeing

standards.title: Information
standards.description: Learners are provided with accurate and accessible information about training, assessment and support services
requirements: Pre-enrolment information is accurate and comprehensive
Information about training products, costs and outcomes is clear
Information is provided in formats accessible to all learners
Learners understand their rights and responsibilities
Changes to information are communicated promptly

standards.title: Training Support
standards.description: Learners receive appropriate training support to achieve their learning outcomes
requirements: Support needs are identified before or during training
Appropriate support services are provided or referred
Support is responsive to individual learner needs
Language, literacy and numeracy support is available
Support facilitates successful training completion

standards.title: Diversity and Inclusion
standards.description: Training and assessment is inclusive and responsive to learner diversity
requirements: Training environment is inclusive and respectful
Diversity is valued and discrimination prevented
Reasonable adjustments are made for learners with disability
Cultural safety is maintained for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander learners
Equity principles are embedded in all practices

standards.title: Wellbeing
standards.description: Learner health, safety and wellbeing is prioritized throughout training delivery
requirements: Safe training environments are provided and maintained
Health and safety risks are identified and mitigated
Wellbeing support is available to learners
Critical incidents are managed appropriately
Work health and safety legislation is complied with

standards.title: Feedback, Complaints and Appeals
standards.description: Effective systems are in place for learner feedback, complaints and appeals
requirements: Feedback mechanisms are accessible and effective
Complaints process is fair, transparent and timely
Appeals process provides independent review of assessment decisions
Learners can raise concerns without fear of reprisal
Feedback and complaints inform continuous improvement

quality_area_3.title: Quality Area 3 - VET Workforce
quality_area_3.description: Outcome-focused requirements for trainer and assessor competence and workforce management

standards.title: VET Workforce Management
standards.description: The VET workforce is appropriately qualified, inducted, supported and developed
requirements: Workforce planning ensures adequate qualified staff
Induction programs prepare staff for their roles
Professional development maintains currency and competence
Performance management supports quality outcomes
Industry engagement maintains workforce currency

standards.title: Trainer and Assessor Competencies
standards.description: Trainers and assessors hold required credentials and maintain vocational competence
requirements: Trainers and assessors hold credentials specified in the Credential Policy
Vocational competence is maintained through industry engagement
Training and assessment skills are current and effective
Credentials are verified and records maintained
Professional development addresses identified needs

quality_area_4.title: Quality Area 4 - Governance
quality_area_4.description: Outcome-focused requirements for leadership, risk management and continuous improvement

standards.title: Leadership and Accountability
standards.description: Effective governance and leadership drive quality training outcomes
requirements: Governance structures support quality outcomes
Roles and responsibilities are clearly defined
Decision-making processes are transparent and accountable
Resources are allocated to support quality training
Leadership demonstrates commitment to compliance and quality

standards.title: Risk Management
standards.description: Risks to quality training outcomes are identified and effectively managed
requirements: Risk management framework is implemented
Risks to training quality and compliance are identified
Risk mitigation strategies are effective
Risk monitoring and review is ongoing
Third party arrangements are effectively managed

standards.title: Continuous Improvement
standards.description: Systematic monitoring and evaluation drive continuous improvement
requirements: Quality indicators are monitored and analyzed
Data informs improvement actions
Improvement strategies are implemented and evaluated
Stakeholder feedback drives improvements
Continuous improvement is embedded in organizational culture

compliance_requirements.title: Information and Transparency
compliance_requirements.description: RTOs provide accurate, accessible and timely information about their operations
requirements: Marketing and advertising is ethical and accurate
Information on training.gov.au is current and accurate
Required information is published on RTO website
Changes to registration are notified promptly
Third party arrangements are disclosed

compliance_requirements.title: Integrity of Nationally Recognised Training Products
compliance_requirements.description: RTOs maintain the integrity of nationally recognised training and only issue AQF certification when requirements are met
requirements: Training and assessment meets requirements of training products
Certifications are issued only when all requirements are met
Training product codes and titles are used correctly
Units of competency are not modified
Packaging rules for qualifications are followed

compliance_requirements.title: Accountability
compliance_requirements.description: RTOs maintain accurate records and comply with reporting requirements
requirements: Student records are accurate, secure and accessible
Reporting obligations are met (AVETMISS, USI, etc.)
Records are retained for required periods
Evidence of training and assessment is maintained
Cooperation with regulatory activities

compliance_requirements.title: Fit and Proper Person Requirements
compliance_requirements.description: RTOs ensure key personnel meet fit and proper person requirements
requirements: Chief executive and high managerial agents meet fit and proper person requirements
Background checks are conducted
Disqualifying factors are identified and addressed
Changes to key personnel are notified
Records of fit and proper person checks are maintained

credential_policy.title: Trainer and Assessor Credentials
credential_policy.description: Trainers and assessors hold credentials specified in the Credential Policy
requirements: Trainers hold TAE qualification or equivalent
Trainers hold vocational competence in area of training
Assessors hold TAE assessment credentials
Assessors hold vocational competence in area of assessment
Currency of credentials is maintained
Credential requirements apply to all delivery modes

credential_policy.title: Validation Credentials
credential_policy.description: Personnel undertaking validation hold appropriate credentials
requirements: Validation is conducted by qualified personnel
Personnel undertaking validation hold vocational competence
Personnel undertaking validation have assessment expertise
Independent validation involves external personnel where required
